summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Log for August 10-11, 2019. It documents the shift activities, counts, and the critical event of inmate Jeffrey Epstein being found unresponsive in his cell, receiving CPR, and being transported to an outside hospital.

persons.name: G. Anderson
persons.context: MCC Operations Lieutenant who reported on the Morning Watch shift, noting staff shortages and the inoperative fire panel. Relieved the Evening Watch Lieutenant at midnight.

persons.name: S. Jean
persons.context: MCC Day Watch Operations Lieutenant who reported inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive and escorted to an outside hospital. Assumed duties at 8:00 AM on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019. CPR was administered, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital.

persons.name: M. Cannata
persons.context: MCC Evening Watch Operations Lieutenant who relieved Lt. S. Jean at 4:00 PM on August 9, 2019. His shift is documented in the log preceding the critical event.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate #86824-054 who was in a dry cell (R-A) and was transferred to special housing (dry cell) on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Mutimura
persons.context: Inmate #76329-054 whose admission is logged during the institutional lockdown count on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Carreon-Macias
persons.context: Inmate #82858-198 who was released on bail bond, logged at 3:59 PM on August 9, 2019.

connections.description: Lt. S. Jean was the Day Watch Operations Lieutenant on duty when inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive and reported the incident.
Both are MCC Operations Lieutenants who relieved each other on different shifts as documented in the daily log.
Lt. S. Jean was relieved of duties by Lt. M. Cannata at 4:00 PM on August 9, 2019, as part of the shift change.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in the Special Housing Unit. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, EMS arrived, and he was transported to a local hospital with CPR still in progress.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Counts
events.description: Routine MCC operations including multiple institutional counts, body alarm tests, equipment checks, and staff shift changes. The fire alarm system was reported inoperable.

events.title: Inmate Transfer and Release
events.description: Inmate Fernandez was transferred to a special housing dry cell, and inmate Carreon-Macias was released on bail bond.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (Inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was administered, EMS was called, and Epstein was transported to a local hospital with CPR still in progress by EMTs.
The MCC's Control Center Fire Panel was reported as inoperative during the Morning Watch shift.
The document is a detailed, chronological prison log showing routine operations and counts leading up to and including the medical emergency involving Epstein.
Epstein was on suicide watch with an inmate companion prior to the incident, as indicated in the 'INMATES IN OUTSIDE HOSPITAL/SUICIDE WATCH' section.
